feat.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. This feat can't increase an ability score above 20.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Actor
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Impersonation
entries: While you're disguised as a real or fictional person, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB} or {@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks to convince others that you are that person.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: You can mimic the sounds of other creatures, including speech. A creature that hears the mimicry must succeed on a Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check to determine the effect is faked ({@dc 8} plus your Charisma modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}).

feat.name: Alert
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Initiative Proficiency
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to the roll.

entries.name: Initiative Swap
entries: Immediately after you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can swap your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} with the {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} of one willing ally in the same combat. You can't make this swap if you or the ally has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

feat.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with Ranged weapons.

feat.name: Athlete
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Climb Speed
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Hop Up
entries: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can right yourself with only 5 feet of movement.

entries.name: Jumping
entries: You can make a running Long or {@variantrule High Jump|XPHB} after moving only 5 feet.

feat.name: Blessed Warrior

otherSummary.entry: When Gaining the Level 2 Paladin "Fighting Style" Feature

entries: You learn two {@filter Cleric cantrips|spells|level=0|class=Cleric} of your choice. {@spell Guidance|XPHB} and {@spell Sacred Flame|XPHB} are recommended. The chosen cantrips count as Paladin spells for you, and Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a Paladin level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another Cleric cantrip.

feat.name: Blind Fighting
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.

feat.name: Boon of Combat Prowess
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Peerless Aim
entries: When you miss with an attack roll, you can hit instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Boon of Dimensional Travel
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Blink Steps
entries: Immediately after you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action or the {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

feat.name: Boon of Energy Resistance
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Energy Resistances
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to two of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Poison, Psychic, Radiant, or Thunder. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your choices.

entries.name: Energy Redirection
entries: When you take damage of one of the types chosen for the Energy Resistances benefit, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to direct damage of the same type toward another creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself that isn't behind {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover}. If you do so, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 8} plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take damage equal to {@dice 2d12} plus your Constitution modifier.

feat.name: Boon of Fate
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Improve Fate
entries: When you or another creature within 60 feet of you succeeds on or fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and apply the total rolled as a bonus or penalty to the {@dice d20} roll. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} or finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Boon of Fortitude
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Fortified Health
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by 40. In addition, whenever you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can regain additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Constitution modifier. Once you've regained these additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Boon of Irresistible Offense
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Overcome Defenses
entries: The Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage you deal always ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

entries.name: Overwhelming Strike
entries: When you roll a 20 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll, you can deal extra damage to the target equal to the ability score increased by this feat. The extra damage's type is the same as the attack's type.

feat.name: Boon of Recovery
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Last Stand
entries: When you would be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Recover Vitality
entries: You have a pool of ten d10s. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend dice from the pool, roll those dice, and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total. You regain all the expended dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Boon of Skill
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: All-Around Adept
entries: You gain proficiency in all skills.

entries.name: Expertise
entries: Choose one skill in which you lack {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB}. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in that skill.

feat.name: Boon of Speed
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Escape Artist
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, which also ends the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition on you.

entries.name: Quickness
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 30 feet.

feat.name: Boon of Spell Recall
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Free Casting
entries: Whenever you cast a spell with a level 1-4 spell slot, roll {@dice 1d4}. If the number you roll is the same as the slot's level, the slot isn't expended.

feat.name: Boon of the Night Spirit
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Merge with Shadows
entries: While within {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, you can give yourself the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. The condition ends on you immediately after you take an action, a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

entries.name: Shadowy Form
entries: While within {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage except Psychic and Radiant.

feat.name: Boon of Truesight
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Truesight
entries: You have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

feat.name: Charger
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Improved Dash
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet for that action.

entries.name: Charge Attack
entries: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line toward a target immediately before hitting it with a melee attack roll as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, choose one of the following effects: gain a {@dice 1d8} bonus to the attack's damage roll, or push the target up to 10 feet away if it is no more than one size larger than you. You can use this benefit only once on each of your turns.

feat.name: Chef
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cook's Utensils
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB} if you don't already have it.

entries.name: Replenishing Meal
entries: As part of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can cook special food if you have ingredients and {@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB} on hand. You can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. At the end of the {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, any creature who eats the food and spends one or more Hit Dice to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} regains an extra {@dice 1d8} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Bolstering Treats
entries: With 1 hour of work or when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can cook a number of treats equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} if you have ingredients and {@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB} on hand. These special treats last 8 hours after being made. A creature can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to eat one of those treats to gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

feat.name: Crafter
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with three different {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice from the Fast Crafting table.

entries.name: Discount
entries: Whenever you buy a nonmagical item, you receive a 20 percent discount on it.

entries.name: Fast Crafting
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can craft one piece of gear from the Fast Crafting table, provided you have the {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} associated with that item and have proficiency with those tools. The item lasts until you finish another {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, at which point the item falls apart.

entries.caption: Fast Crafting
rows: {@item Crossbow Bolt Case|XPHB}, {@item Map or Scroll Case|XPHB}, {@item Pouch|XPHB}
{@item Ball Bearings|XPHB}, {@item Bucket|XPHB}, {@item Caltrops|XPHB}, {@item Grappling Hook|XPHB}, {@item Iron Pot|XPHB}

feat.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Ignore Loading
entries: You ignore the {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading} property of the {@item Hand Crossbow|XPHB}, {@item Heavy Crossbow|XPHB}, and {@item Light Crossbow|XPHB} (all called crossbows elsewhere in this feat). If you're holding one of them, you can load a piece of ammunition into it even if you lack a free hand.

entries.name: Firing in Melee
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with crossbows.

entries.name: Dual Wielding
entries: When you make the extra attack of the {@itemProperty L|XPHB|Light} property, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the extra attack if that attack is with a crossbow that has the {@itemProperty L|XPHB|Light} property and you aren't already adding that modifier to the damage.

feat.name: Crusher
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Push
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space if the target is no more than one size larger than you.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} that deals Bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Defense
entries: While you're wearing Light, Medium, or Heavy armor, you gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

feat.name: Defensive Duelist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Parry
entries: If you're holding a Finesse weapon and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}, potentially causing the attack to miss you. You gain this bonus to your AC against melee attacks until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Druidic Warrior

otherSummary.entry: When Gaining the Level 2 Ranger "Fighting Style" Feature

entries: You learn two {@filter Druid cantrips|spells|level=0|class=druid} of your choice. {@spell Guidance|XPHB} and {@spell Starry Wisp|XPHB} are recommended. The chosen cantrips count as Ranger spells for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a Ranger level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another Druid cantrip.

feat.name: Dual Wielder
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Enhanced Dual Wielding
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and attack with a weapon that has the {@itemProperty L|XPHB|Light} property, you can make one extra attack as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} later on the same turn with a different weapon, which must be a Melee weapon that lacks the {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed} property. You don't add your ability modifier to the extra attack's damage unless that modifier is negative.

entries.name: Quick Draw
entries: You can draw or stow two weapons that lack the {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed} property when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

feat.name: Dueling
entries: When you're holding a Melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

feat.name: Durable
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Defy Death
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}.

entries.name: Speedy Recovery
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one of your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, roll the die, and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll.

feat.name: Elemental Adept
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Energy Mastery
entries: Choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. Spells you cast ignore {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to damage of the chosen type. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals damage of that type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different damage type each time for Energy Mastery.

feat.name: Fey-Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Feywild's magic grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Fey Magic
entries: Choose one {@filter level 1 spell from the Divination or Enchantment|spells|level=1|school=E;D} school of magic. You always have that spell and the {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Grappler
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Punch and Grab
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can use both the Damage and the Grapple option. You can use this benefit only once per turn.

entries.name: Attack Advantage
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against a creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you.

entries.name: Fast Wrestler
entries: You don't have to spend extra movement to move a creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you if the creature is your size or smaller.

feat.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll damage for an attack you make with a Melee weapon that you are holding with two hands, you can treat any 1 or 2 on a damage die as a 3. The weapon must have the {@itemProperty 2h|XPHB|Two-Handed} or {@itemProperty V|XPHB|Versatile} property to gain this benefit.

feat.name: Great Weapon Master
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heavy Weapon Mastery
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon that has the {@itemProperty H|XPHB|Heavy} property as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target. The extra damage equals your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Hew
entries: Immediately after you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a Melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with one, you can make one attack with the same weapon as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

feat.name: Healer
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Battle Medic
entries: If you have a {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB}, you can expend one use of it and tend to a creature within 5 feet of yourself as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. That creature can expend one of its {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, and you then roll that die. The creature regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Healing Rerolls
entries: Whenever you roll a die to determine the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} you restore with a spell or with this feat's Battle Medic benefit, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.

feat.name: Heavily Armored
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Training
entries: You gain training with Heavy armor.

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Damage Reduction
entries: When you're hit by an attack while you're wearing Heavy armor, any Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage dealt to you by that attack is reduced by an amount equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

feat.name: Inspiring Leader
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bolstering Performance
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can give an inspiring performance: a speech, song, or dance. When you do so, choose up to six allies (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of yourself who witness the performance. The chosen creatures each gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your character level plus the modifier of the ability you increased with this feat.

feat.name: Interception
entries: When a creature you can see hits another creature within 5 feet of you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the damage dealt to the target by {@dice 1d10} plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. You must be holding a {@item Shield|XPHB} or a Simple or Martial weapon to use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

feat.name: Keen Mind
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Lore Knowledge
entries: Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, or {@skill Religion|XPHB}. If you lack proficiency in the chosen skill, you gain proficiency in it, and if you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

entries.name: Quick Study
entries: You can take the {@action Study|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

feat.name: Lightly Armored
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Training
entries: You gain training with Light armor and Shields.

feat.name: Lucky
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Luck Points
entries: You have a number of Luck Points equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and can spend the points on the benefits below. You regain your expended Luck Points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Advantage
entries: When you roll a {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can spend 1 Luck Point to give yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll.

entries.name: Disadvantage
entries: When a creature rolls a {@dice d20} for an attack roll against you, you can spend 1 Luck Point to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that roll.

feat.name: Mage Slayer
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Concentration Breaker
entries: When you damage a creature that is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating}, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw it makes to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entries.name: Guarded Mind
entries: If you fail an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw, you can cause yourself to succeed instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Magic Initiate
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric}, {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid}, or {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the same list you selected for this feat's cantrips. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of the spells you chose for this feat with a different spell of the same level from the chosen spell list.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different spell list each time.

items.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).

items.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

items.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).

items.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

items.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).

items.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

feat.name: Martial Weapon Training
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Weapon Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@filter Martial weapons|items|type=martial weapon}.

feat.name: Medium Armor Master
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dexterous Wearer
entries: While you're wearing Medium armor, you can add 3, rather than 2 to your AC if you have a Dexterity score of 16 or higher.

feat.name: Moderately Armored
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Training
entries: You gain training with Medium armor.

feat.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Mounted Strike
entries: While {@book mounted|XPHB|1|Mounted Combat}, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any unmounted creature within 5 feet of your mount that is at least one size smaller than the mount.

entries.name: Leap Aside
entries: If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails. For your mount to gain this benefit, you must be riding it, and neither of you can have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Veer
entries: While {@book mounted|XPHB|1|Mounted Combat}, you can force an attack that hits your mount to hit you instead if you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

feat.name: Musician
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Instrument Training
entries: You gain proficiency with three Musical Instruments of your choice.

entries.name: Encouraging Song
entries: As you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can play a song on a {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB} with which you have proficiency and give {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to allies who hear the song. The number of allies you can affect in this way equals your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

feat.name: Observant
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Keen Observer
entries: Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Insight|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, or {@skill Perception|XPHB}. If you lack proficiency with the chosen skill, you gain proficiency in it, and if you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

entries.name: Quick Search
entries: You can take the {@action Search|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

feat.name: Piercer
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Puncture
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} that deals Piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra Piercing damage the target takes.

feat.name: Poisoner
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Potent Poison
entries: When you make a damage roll that deals Poison damage, it ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage.

entries.name: Brew Poison
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item Poisoner's Kit|XPHB}. With 1 hour of work using such a kit and expending 50 GP worth of materials, you can create a number of poison doses equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can apply a poison dose to a weapon or piece of ammunition. Once applied, the poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until you deal damage with the poisoned item, whichever is shorter. When a creature takes damage from the poisoned item, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 8} plus the modifier of the ability increased by this feat and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take {@damage 2d8} Poison damage and have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Polearm Master
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Pole Strike
entries: Immediately after you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and attack with a {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, a {@item Spear|XPHB}, or a {@filter weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon|property=heavy;reach=sand}, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon. The weapon deals Bludgeoning damage, and the weapon's damage die for this attack is a {@dice d4}.

entries.name: Reactive Strike
entries: While you're holding a {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, a {@item Spear|XPHB}, or a {@filter weapon that has the Heavy and Reach properties|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon|property=heavy;reach=sand}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one melee attack against a creature that enters the reach you have with that weapon.

feat.name: Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to interpose your {@item Shield|XPHB} if you're holding one. You impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the triggering attack roll and all other attack rolls against the target until the start of your next turn if you remain within 5 feet of the target.

feat.name: Resilient

choose.entry: Choose one ability in which you lack saving throw proficiency. Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Saving Throw Proficiency
entries: You gain saving throw proficiency with the chosen ability.

feat.name: Ritual Caster
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Ritual Spells
entries: Choose a number of level 1 spells equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} that have the {@filter Ritual tag|spells|level=1|components & miscellaneous=ritual}. You always have those spells prepared, and you can cast them with any spell slots you have. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat. Whenever your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} increases thereafter, you can add an additional level 1 spell with the {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB} tag to the spells always prepared with this feature.

entries.name: Quick Ritual
entries: With this benefit, you can cast a {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB} spell that you have prepared using its regular casting time rather than the extended time for a {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB}. Doing so doesn't require a spell slot. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't use this benefit again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Savage Attacker
entries: You've trained to deal particularly damaging strikes. Once per turn when you hit a target with a weapon, you can roll the weapon's damage dice twice and use either roll against the target.

feat.name: Sentinel
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Guardian
entries: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you takes the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action or hits a target other than you with an attack, you can make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} against that creature.

entries.name: Halt
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, the creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} becomes 0 for the rest of the current turn.

feat.name: Shadow-Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Shadow Magic
entries: Choose one {@filter level 1 spell from the Illusion or Necromancy|spells|level=1|school=I;N} school of magic. You always have that spell and the {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Sharpshooter
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bypass Cover
entries: Your ranged attacks with weapons ignore {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} and {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover}.

entries.name: Firing in Melee
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.

entries.name: Long Shots
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with Ranged weapons.

feat.name: Shield Master
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries: If you attack a creature within 5 feet of you as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and hit with a Melee weapon, you can immediately bash the target with your {@item Shield|XPHB} if it's equipped, forcing the target to make a Strength saving throw ({@dc 8} plus your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, you either push the target 5 feet from you or cause it to have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition (your choice). You can use this benefit only once on each of your turns.

entries.name: Interpose Shield
entries: If you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and are holding a {@item Shield|XPHB}.

feat.name: Skill Expert
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Skill Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Expertise
entries: Choose one skill in which you have proficiency but lack {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB}. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} with that skill.

feat.name: Skilled
entries: You gain proficiency in any combination of three {@table Skill List; Skills|XPHB|skills} or {@filter tools|items|type=tool;artisan's tools;instrument;gaming set} of your choice.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Skulker
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Blindsight
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.

entries.name: Fog of War
entries: You exploit the distractions of battle, gaining {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check you make as part of the {@action Hide|XPHB} action during combat.

entries.name: Sniper
entries: If you make an attack roll while hidden and the roll misses, making the attack roll doesn't reveal your location.

feat.name: Slasher
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hamstring
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Slashing damage, you can reduce the {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of that creature by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} that deals Slashing damage to a creature, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Speedy
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Speed Increase
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Dash over Difficult Terrain
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action on your turn, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement for the rest of that turn.

entries.name: Agile Movement
entries: {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you.

feat.name: Spell Sniper
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Bypass Cover
entries: Your attack rolls for spells ignore {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} and {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover}.

entries.name: Casting in Melee
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls with spells.

entries.name: Increased Range
entries: When you cast a spell that has a range of at least 10 feet and requires you to make an attack roll, you can increase the spell's range by 60 feet.

feat.name: Tavern Brawler
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Enhanced Unarmed Strike
entries: When you hit with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and deal damage, you can deal Bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d4} plus your Strength modifier instead of the normal damage of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Damage Rerolls
entries: Whenever you roll a damage die for your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.

entries.name: Improvised Weaponry
entries: You have proficiency with improvised weapons.

entries.name: Push
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can deal damage to the target and also push it 5 feet away from you. You can use this benefit only once per turn.

feat.name: Telekinetic
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Minor Telekinesis
entries: You learn the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} spell. You can cast it without Verbal or Somatic components, you can make the spectral hand {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, and its range and the distance it can be away from you both increase by 30 feet when you cast it. The spell's spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

entries.name: Telekinetic Shove
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw ({@dc 8} plus the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or be moved 5 feet toward or away from you.

feat.name: Telepathic
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Telepathic Utterance
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

entries.name: Detect Thoughts
entries: You always have the {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it without a spell slot or spell components, and you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast it using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: When you hit with a ranged attack roll using a weapon that has the {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} property, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

feat.name: Tough
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your character level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a character level thereafter, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by an additional 2 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

feat.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you make an extra attack as a result of using a weapon that has the {@itemProperty L|XPHB|Light} property, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of that attack if you aren't already adding it to the damage.

feat.name: Unarmed Fighting
entries: When you hit with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and deal damage, you can deal Bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} plus your Strength modifier instead of the normal damage of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. If you aren't holding any weapons or a {@item Shield|XPHB} when you make the attack roll, the {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}.
At the start of each of your turns, you can deal {@damage 1d4} Bludgeoning damage to one creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you.

feat.name: War Caster
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entries.name: Reactive Spell
entries: When a creature provokes an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} from you by leaving your reach, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast a spell at the creature rather than making an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}. The spell must have a casting time of one action and must target only that creature.

entries.name: Somatic Components
entries: You can perform the Somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a {@item Shield|XPHB} in one or both hands.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Mastery Property
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of one kind of Simple or Martial weapon of your choice, provided you have proficiency with it. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kind of weapon to another eligible kind.
